definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: This will initiate a neurological chain reaction that will help move us in the right direction.
sentences.chinese: 这将引发一些列能将我们引导到正确方向的连锁反应。

sentences.english: We had a chain reaction of them here, she adds.
sentences.chinese: 她补充说，当时，韩国出现了一系列的连锁反应。

sentences.english: This chain reaction magnifies the pressure of sound waves more than 20 times.
sentences.chinese: 经过这种连锁反应，声波的压力放大了20倍以上。

sentences.english: The knock-on effects of this lack of responsibilty are manifold, the report claims.
sentences.chinese: 该报告说，这种缺乏责任的连锁反应是多方面的。

sentences.english: Gastroenteritis can be met by a person, there will be a series of knock-on effect.
sentences.chinese: 可遇上了一个胃肠炎的人，便会产生一连串连锁反应。

sentences.english: Click on one of the tiles to start a chain reaction with tiles that are connected.
sentences.chinese: 关于瓷砖按一个开始与该连接瓷砖的连锁反应。

sentences.english: The studies of models and algorithms for evaluating cascading faults in com plicated power systems are given.
sentences.chinese: 对评估复杂电力系统连锁反应事故的模型进行了研究。

sentences.english: There are signs in some places that this may already be underway.
sentences.chinese: 在一些地方，已经显示出这一系列连锁反应的征兆。

sentences.english: It is as if a singleunimportant event set up a chain of reactions.
sentences.chinese: 好像是一件无关紧要的小事引起了一连串的连锁反应。

sentences.english: The lack of “exits” from investments had a further knock-on effect.
sentences.chinese: 缺少获利“了解的出口”会进一步引起连锁反应。

sentences.english: And by what the plan caused at 0 o'clock long swimming chain-reacting still won't end at this point.
sentences.chinese: 而由零点计划引发的久游的连锁反应还不会就此结束。

sentences.english: The net effect of this interference is a blunting of curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 这种干涉造成的连锁反应就是好奇心逐渐钝化。

sentences.english: And a frugal American superpower is sure to have ripple effects around the globe.
sentences.chinese: 一个穷酸的美国超级大国必定要在全球产生连锁反应。

sentences.english: It would trigger panic selling of the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 这会引起连锁反应恐慌性的抛售美元。

sentences.english: This in effect can have a chain reaction of property changes.
sentences.chinese: 实际上这将引起属性更改的连锁反应。

sentences.english: Yes, there will be some knock-on effects in the industry.
sentences.chinese: 整个行业会出现一些连锁反应。

definition: to lead to/to trigger/to initiate/to cause/to evoke (emotions)
lit. pull one hair and the whole body moves/fig. a slight change will affect everything else/the butterfly effect
pinyin: qian1 yi1 fa4 er2 dong4 quan2 shen1

definition: to cause to burn/to ignite/to detonate/a fuse
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
